intro: Nierembergia browallioides, commonly known as the velvetleaf bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sun. Its foliage is often covered in a fine, velvety texture, giving it its common name. Nierembergia browallioides is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
